intro: Erigeron monorchis, commonly known as the single-seedleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its daisy-like appearance with white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy leaves and a slender stem, and its flowers bloom in the summer months. Erigeron monorchis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
